text: Martina Altenberger is Paralympic alpine skier from Austria. She competed for Austria in the 1988 Winter Paralympics in Innsbruck and won three gold medals. == Career == She took part in the 1986 World Disabled Ski Championships. At the 1988 Winter Paralympics in Innsbruck, she competed in the LW6/8 category and won three gold medals: # Giant Slalom: She finished with a time of 1:45.59, ahead of American Kathy Pitcher, who won silver, and Polish skier Eszbieta Dadok, who won bronze. 2\. Slalom: She finished with a time of 1:15.63, ahead of Gunilla Ahren (1:19.09) and Eszbieta Dadok (1:37.46). 3\. Downhill: She finished with a time of 1:13.87, ahead of Nancy Gustafson (1:14.51) and Gunilla Ahren (1:17.64). She trained with Skiclub Niedernsill. == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Paralympic alpine skiers for Austria Category:Paralympic gold medalists for Austria Category:Austrian female alpine skiers Category:Alpine skiers at the 1988 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1988 Winter Paralympics
title: Martina Altenberger
